page.title: 03LAW AND ORDER
page.content: Our sub-divisions of Merseyside Police has a superintendent in charge at Copy Lane Police Station. The sub-division is divided up into beats. The beats in the town are much smaller than those in the country because thereis more property to protect. The men work 24 hours a day in a 3-shift system beginning at 7 a.m. There are 3 beats covering our area with one man to each beat. There is l panda car to each 3 beats. These cars and some traffic cars are based at Maghull Police station which deals mainly with traffic incidents. There aren't enough police to have men and cars for each beat, so there is a 'ripple' system to provide back-up where needed. The man on the beat can radio for pandas, then fast response cars, then special support cars if necessary.
